topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537a85bd6368725d9b4d0400#post_537a85bd6368725d9b4d0400
That's great news, it's good to see the US is finally being liberated from such draconian oppression. I really hope this keeps going and has an effect on getting rid of other laws involving peoples' personal lives, sexual or otherwise.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537a8623636872037bc60500#post_537a8623636872037bc60500
[bq="SeraphimDawn"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537a85bd6368725d9b4d0400#post_537a85bd6368725d9b4d0400
Which states are left?[/bq]
I don't know actually; with so many states striking them down it's hard to keep track of at this point.  There's I believe 32 states that still have bans, *BUT* most of those states currently have court cases on them.  Right now Texas' ban is going to the appeals court; I don't have a date on that though.

Considering how many states currently have appeals there's going to be a lot of states legalizing gay marriage in the fall.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537a869063687210f8fd0200#post_537a869063687210f8fd0200
While your other freedoms are being stripped away?

Censorship is becoming more rampant.
NSA is bluntly violating the privacy of citizens.
Your movement can get heavily restricted by the government as soon as they suspect you of being a terrorist.
Healthcare is expensive as frik.
Unemployment
And foreclosure.
Marijuana is still very illegal in the US.
Last but not least, archaic copyright laws.

topics.body:
I say it's probably going to be legalized in the usa by the next president because to break it down chances are a lot of states in fall and spring will legalize gay marriage and over the next year and three quarters the rest of stragglers slowly coming in behind.

Chances are that's going to be the hot topic in the news during the fall, how many states are legalizing gay marriage.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537a87e36368721fb04d0300#post_537a87e36368721fb04d0300
Oh by the way, here's a fun law to give an idea of how "free" this country is: in the great state of Michigan it used to illegal to have sex with anyone other than in the missionary position. The punishment was _life in prison_. The law was only struck down after the SCOTUS ruled it unconstitutional. The ruling was not from several decades ago, only a few years ago. That's just one of the many examples of how I wish the government would seriously get the hell out of out personal lives and how I _wish_ people would get off their asses and actually do something to take back their freedom.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537a89fa63687225e4a40300#post_537a89fa63687225e4a40300

Louisiana plans on reinstating their anti-sodomy law even though it was ruled unconstitutional.
